file_content.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa! You got all the soldiers. We ain't fighters, just miners. Contracted miners at that.
Where is General Frellka?
He's the overseer, but he ain't exactly hands on--hasn't been by in weeks. You gonna kill him?
Yes. You have a problem with that?
That's right.
Hmm, not really. Every job ends at some point.
Why are you so curious?
What's it to you?
Hey, not looking for any trouble here.
Doesn't have to be violent. I seek a peaceful meeting.
Just want to talk.
I see. Makes no real never mind to me.
The Republic don't pay me enough to get in your way, believe me.
If I hit the silent alarm, Frellka'll come with his personal guard. If that's really what you want, I can bring him here.
Hit the alarm.
Do it.
You got it.
I'm not going to hurt you.
I'm gonna trust you on that.
This unnecessary chitchat is angering me.
I'm growing impatient.
No no no, don't want that. Here, I'll trigger the alarm!
There, it's done. The general's been summoned. Now, please, just let us live.
How much time do you think this will take?
Will I have to wait long?
My sense is the general ain't holed up too close to here. Might be a while.
I don't like to repeat myself, so you die.
You doubt my word? [Kill]
You've used up your usefulness.
Nah. [Kill]
No!
Just leave.
Pack it up, boys, job's over.
Enemy sighted! Captain, attack pattern aught-seven-seven.
Men, fan out! Aught-seven-seven! Be ready to engage, wait for the general's order!
Foreman Varl, good work tripping the silent alarm. You show uncharacteristic mercy, Sith, leaving Varl and his crew alive.
Foreman Varl was picked up and confessed a Sith was here. So, I was able to bring backup.
You'll find my elite troopers much more formidable than the guards and miners you massacred here, Sith.
I am General Elaxis Frellka of the Republic Strategic High Command. Your incursion here violates the spirit of the Treaty of Coruscant. We have you dead to rights, surrender.
Excellent. I've been looking for you.
Ah, General Frellka.
Be careful what you wish for, Sith.
I have no reverence for the Treaty of Coruscant.
I violate anything I like.
That explains your clumsiness coming here.
If I had a sense of humor, I'd find you amusing.
That's a laugh.
We have prisons that can stand up to Sith. Perhaps you'll find them funny.
It's unfortunate you've discovered our plans, but no matter. The wheels are already in motion.
Our new technology will deliver arms superiority to the Republic. And I'm ready to give my life to defend this installation.
We are in accordance--I'm ready to take your life.
Then prepare to die. [Attack]
Men, fight to the death!
Exactly what are you mining here that will provide such an advantage?
Wait, what technology?
You mean you don't know? Oh, this is too rich.
I only want you.
My mission is simply to neutralize you. Surrender to me and live.
Hmm. I need more than that. Allow my men to continue this operation, I will allow myself to be taken captive.
You have no bargaining power here.
No deal.
For a second, I thought there might be something special about you, Sith. Now I see how typical you are.
You have my word.
Very well. Captain, have the men stand down. I freely place myself in this Sith's custody.
General, I cannot abide this. You must not be lost.
The project must endure, Captain. I am insignificant in comparison. You will obey my order.
Yes, sir. You will be remembered.
Now, Sith, I am your prisoner. it's a small price to pay for my project to thrive.
Quinn, take the general back to the Imperial Outpost.
Right away, my lord.
But I'm compelled to stress--based on the general's bold statements, it seems ill-advised to allow this operation to continue.
I'm following Baras's directive. He wants the War Trust neutralized. Their plans do not matter.
Our orders were specific.
I see. I will comply with your literal interpretation, my lord. Thank you for tolerating my interjection.
Vette, kindly escort the general back to the Imperial Outpost.
Fine by me. Happy to leave--whatever they're mining here stinks!
But I gotta ask--are you actually going to let this operation continue? After what the general said?
Baras specifically said to neutralize the generals. He doesn't care about their plans.
Just following orders.
Well, hey, you're the boss.
Do you want me to change my mind?
Are you complaining?
Oh, not at all. I think it's great.
Let's go, General. Gotta take you to your cell now.
On second thought, I must destroy this facility and everyone in it. Just to be safe.
I better not.
Jaesa, see the general safely back to the Imperial Outpost.
Very good, master. Death would be a mercy for him.
But I have to ask--considering what the general said about the War Trust's plan, you're not actually going to let this operation continue, right?
My directives are not to be challenged.
Do not question me.
Of course, master. Excuse my impertinence.
Come, General, your cell awaits.
Of course, my lord. Only doing my job to the best of my ability.
General, it will be my honor to take you into Imperial custody.
Of course, my lord. Your mercy is commendable.
You will be honoring your word, yes? You're leaving this facility operational.
Our master was explicit--all that matters are the generals. What they're up to means nothing, remember?
Baras doesn't care.
I admire your capacity to walk this thin line, my lord.
Ah, I think I understand. At worst, it's Baras's judgment that will be questioned. It will expose his weakness.
Very good, master. I bow to your forethought. Come, General, it's time for your imprisonment.
It saddens me that you doubt my character. I am a man of my word.
I'm hurt, Jaesa.
Oh, I'm so sorry, my lord. I feel awful. I should not have suggested such a thing.
Come, General. You can relax--your men will be safe.
No, this operation must cease, and everyone here must be destroyed.
I was lying.
No! What was I thinking, negotiating with a Sith!
The Sith lied! Stop them! Save the general!
Lieutenant, General Frellka has surrendered to me. Have Moff Hurdenn send a squad to retrieve him.
Pierce, I have a prisoner.
Right away, my lord. Pierce out.
The general will be held in our finest cell. There's only one family of rats there.
I expect him to be treated well, Lieutenant.
No harm shall come to him.
Fine. Whatever you say, my lord.
If you interrogate him, try not to let this one expire, all right?
Just don't kill him.
Oh, I'll be real careful.
The general will never see the light of day again.
Throw away the key.
Men, escort the general back to the base. Time for him to enjoy good, old-fashioned Imperial hospitality.
My lord, I may have a line on another of your targets soon. I will contact you when I do.
You got what you wanted, Sith. Leave now, as you promised the general.
You will tell me where the other generals of the War Trust are stationed. Now.
We're General Frellka's men. The other generals' whereabouts are classified, even to us. They're very careful not to leave a trail.
If you know anything, you can save your general a lot of pain and suffering.
I'll beat it out of Frellka.
You filth. Fine. I won't be responsible for the general being tortured.
I know nothing of General Faraire and General Durant. But General Minst is in charge of receiving the mined materials from this cave.
He's stationed in an old power reactor amid the destroyed sewers of old Taris.
You have dodged death twice today.
You're awfully sure of yourself, Sith.
Don't worry, I'll make sure General Minst is warned about you.
The Republic is destined to die if you exemplify its cowardly spirit.
I appreciate the assistance.
Maybe.
I cannot leave something this important to chance.
Ha! Maybe you missed it, but I've come with more than enough force to stop you.
I can't let you leave and tell the Empire what you've seen.
Men, this Sith must not be allowed to reveal our operation. Attack to kill!
I change my mind.
[Force Persuade] Tell me.
I'll spare them too. Promise.
